page.title: 11GLASSHOUSES SCHOOL
page.content: The Metcalfe Family opened the the school in the Mill in 1840 in order that the children who worked at the Mill could be educated at the same time. It cost each child 2d per week. In 1860 the school moved into a newly-built schoolhouse across the road from the Mill and at that time there were about 160 pupils, all part- time and it was not until 1895 that the Schools Board took over the school. Today the school has 42 pupils, who are housed in an enlarged school (about 1913) which has a room for the infants, one for the juniors, and a third for the teachers; they also have indoor toilets and a cloakroom; they may have school dinners or take packed lunches and they spend their playtimes in the two playgrounds and gardens surrounding the school.
